item.title: Ban on sand flathead fishing in south-eastern Tasmania amid severe decline in numbers
item.description: Populations of sand flathead have "severely declined" in Tasmanian waters, prompting the government to close a fishery in the state's south-east to recreational anglers.

item.description: Australia's netballers expect to gain precious intelligence ahead of a showpiece tournament when they host Jamaica in a three-Test series.

item.title: Report finds NT residents feel less safe and less satisfied with police despite crime crackdown
item.description: A new report reveals NT residents felt less safe over the past year, despite a government crackdown on crime.

item.title: $15b National Reconstruction Fund allowed to back 'losers' in push to cut emissions
item.description: The $15 billion fund will be allowed to back riskier green projects under new rules announced today.

item.title: Malaysian PM Anwar Ibrahim and India's Narendra Modi named in Epstein files
item.description: The prime ministers of Malaysia and India deny having links with disgraced financier Jeffrey Epstein after their names appeared in a tranche of files released by the US Department of Justice.

item.title: Trump's failure to extend nuclear treaty leaves door 'wide open' to arms race
item.description: The last remaining nuclear arms pact between the United States and Russia has come to an end at a time of global instability.

item.title: NSW parliamentary inquiry to investigate mould and maggot issues at Newcastle's Mater Hospital
item.description: Shadow Minister for Health Sarah Mitchell has successfully moved a motion in parliament for an inquiry at the Calvary Mater Hospital, after the discovery of mould and maggots.

item.description: Melody Wehipeihana was dropping her kids off at school when she pulled over to see what a crowd had gathered to look at in a puddle outside a Northern Territory pub.

item.description: Thomas Fancutt has made his return to professional tennis after receiving a 10-month ban for a vitamin and magnesium infusion.

item.description: A fake AFP office staged by scammers who operated from a Cambodian scam centre reveals much about their tactics, experts say.

item.title: Olympic sports face 'difficult conversations' before Brisbane 2032 as IOC president confirms reforms
item.description: Brisbane Olympic organisers say they do not know what events will be at the 2032 Games, as IOC president Kirsty Coventry says her reforms will result in "difficult conversations" with established sports.

item.description: Penny bested six other finalists at New York's Madison Square Garden to win the show dog world's most coveted prize, after more than 2,500 dogs strutted their stuff.

item.description: Zjaequaan Sebasio's family and WA Police are urging anyone with information about his location to come forward, after his disappearance almost a week ago.

item.title: Living costs rise for all but some hit harder, new ABS data finds
item.description: Cost-of-living pressures are being felt by all households, but some have been hit harder than others as annual costs increased between 2.3 and 4.2 per cent in 2025, according to the Australian Bureau of Statistics.

item.title: K'gari traditional owners hold smoking ceremony for Piper James on beach where she died
item.description: K'gari traditional owners have held a smoking ceremony for Piper James, who died on the island last month, to give her spirit a safe passage home.

item.title: Raymond Reddington's trial told wife Sharon Fulton was murdered for insurance money
item.description: Raymond Reddington failed to report his wife missing for several days, changed his story multiple times and wrote a fake confession letter to the state coroner, a Perth court hears.

item.description: An inquest has wrapped up into the disappearance of Sydney escort Revelle Balmain, 31 years after she was reported missing.

item.description: WA children's author Craig Silvey gets his bail conditions altered by a Perth court after complaining of "significant media attention" since being charged with child exploitation offences.

item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Jacinta Allan backs Kyneton footballers to find new league amid appeal controversy
item.description: A former football administrator has criticised AFL Victoria's decision not to allow a club to join a women-only league in Central Victoria.

item.title: Police to resume searching for Celine Cremer items at Waratah after bones discovery
item.description: Tasmania Police will again head into thick bushland to continue searching for more items in the area where Belgian tourist Celine Cremer vanished in 2023 — after the shock discovery of bones last week.

item.title: Queensland's free influenza vaccine program to return this year with nasal spray for children aged two to five
item.description: The program — which will run from March to September — will provide free flu vaccinations, including a nasal spray option for children aged two to five years.

item.title: Inside Ryan Wesley Routh's plan to kill Donald Trump and 'up-end American democracy'
item.description: As Donald Trump arrived at a golf course in September 2024, a would-be assassin had already been lying in wait for almost 12 hours.

item.title: RecipeTin Eats' Nagi Maehashi is normalising taking time off for pets. Here's why that matters.
item.description: Experts say our pets have become such an important part of our lives that it's important to take a step back from responsibilities, if possible, when they are sick or dying.

item.title: Bullock says government spending not sole factor pushing inflation higher as political fight heats up
item.description: RBA governor Michele Bullock has refused to blame the Albanese government for rising inflation, as a political fight breaks out in the wake of the bank's rate hike.

item.title: Josh Hazlewood out of T20 World Cup with injury in another blow to Australia's hopes
item.description: Josh Hazlewood is ruled out of Australia's T20 World Cup campaign as he continues to recover from the injuries which kept him from playing in the summer's Ashes series.

item.title: Perth council in 'respectful' disagreement over spending choices on meals and rent
item.description: A newly elected councillor in the Shire of Serpentine-Jarrahdale, in Perth's outer-eastern fringe, accuses the shire of making poor spending choices with ratepayers' money.

item.title: Patrol boats out of action in Cairns shipyards as foreign fishers reach Australian shores
item.description: A "continuous" influx of illegal foreign fishing boats in Queensland waters coincides with at least two of the nation's fleet of patrol boats being out of commission.

item.title: Light plane crashes into ocean at Goolwa South on South Australia's south coast
item.description: The Australian Transport Safety Bureau says it has begun an investigation into a crash involving a single-engine Cessna aeroplane which has "collided with water".

item.title: Why it took police nine days to declare the Invasion Day attempted bomb attack in Perth terrorism
item.description: When a homemade fragment bomb was allegedly thrown into a crowd on January 26, it took nine days for it to be declared an act of terrorism. The WA police commissioner explains why, as Indigenous leaders raise concerns.

item.title: Showers and storms to move towards south-east Australia
item.description: Follow the latest headlines from ABC News, Australia's most trusted media source, with live events, audio and on-demand video from the national broadcaster.

item.title: Sarah Snook, The Newsreader and Bring Her Back triumph at AACTA Awards — as it happened
item.description: Australia's answer to the Oscars — the AACTAs — lit up the Gold Coast tonight, with horror Bring Her Back and The Narrow Road to the Deep North dominating.

item.title: Bushfire warning downgraded for blaze in Darlington, Helena Valley in Perth's eastern suburbs
item.description: Fire authorities downgrade a bushfire in Darlington and Helena Valley as it becomes stationary but not controlled.

item.title: Senior Russian military official in hospital after being shot
item.description: Lieutenant General Vladimir Alexeyev, a senior Russian military official, has been rushed to hospital after being shot in Moscow.

item.title: Accused murderer Shaun Michael Dunk told police he wanted to kill 'a few people', court hears
item.description: A recorded police interview reveals that a man accused of killing a woman at a real estate business in Adelaide was not satisfied with his alleged murder.

item.title: Friday finance with David Chau
item.description: News from the world of finance and business. Top stories in text, video and audio. Business video news bulletin. Features and analysis.

item.title: Pentagon reportedly asked to probe SpaceX for potential Chinese ownership seen as a 'national security threat'
item.description: Chinese investment in Elon Musk's company SpaceX has been cited as a "national security threat", according to senators Elizabeth Warren and Andy Kim.

item.title: Suicide bombing at Islamabad mosque kills at least 31 people and wounds 169 others
item.description: The explosion rocked the mosque on the outskirts of Pakistan's capital during Friday prayer.

item.title: Evidence concludes in inquest into psychiatric patient's death at Alice Springs Hospital
item.description: A coronial inquest has heard that the death of a 34-year-old mother who was repeatedly sedated during a schizophrenic episode was "entirely preventable".

item.title: AACTA 2026 winners list: Gory horror wins best film, Jacob Elordi drama dominates TV
item.description: Directors Danny and Michael Philippou clean up at the 2026 AACTA awards, taking home 10 statues for their chilling horror film Bring Her Back.

item.title: Tropical Cyclone Mitchell forms off Western Australia's Pilbara coast
item.description: Residents along WA's Pilbara coast have been warned to expect gale force winds and heavy rain over the next 48 hours as Cyclone Mitchell drifts down the coast.

item.title: Small plane crashes in Normanton, north-west Queensland, starting grass fire and knocking out power
item.description: Only the pilot was on board, police said, adding that his injuries remain unknown and that the response to the incident is ongoing.

item.title: Daisy Thomas, competing without an ACL, suffers heavy crash at Milano Cortina Winter Olympic Games
item.description: Australian freestyle skier Daisy Thomas, who is competing at the 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympic Games without an ACL, suffers a heavy fall in slopestyle training and has withdrawn from the event to focus on big air.

item.title: Indirect talks between US and Iran finish in Oman with indication they will continue
item.description: The two countries held talks mediated by Oman in Muscat after weeks of tensions between Washington and Tehran.

item.title: US accuses China of secret nuclear testing as Washington calls for Beijing to be part of new arms deal
item.description: The claim comes as the US calls for China to be involved in a new deal limiting the use of nuclear weapons, after the New START deal expired this week.

item.title: Donald Trump posts, then deletes, video depicting Obamas as monkeys on his social media platform
item.description: The video also included several debunked conspiracy theories linked to the 2020 US election, which the president has falsely claimed was stolen from him.

item.title: Albanese's invitation to Herzog is a shift in his approach to Israel
item.description: Unravelling the threads of antisemitism and anti-Israeli sentiment will require both more political courage and more community tolerance than we have seen to date.

item.title: Budget reform is back as Labor shapes second term agenda
item.description: As the opposition and government wrestled in the hay barn over who's to blame for this week's Reserve Bank interest rate increase, there's a much bigger story unfolding in the wings.

item.title: Live: 'Another world is possible': Calls for unity at Winter Olympics opening
item.description: The 2026 Milano Cortina Winter Olympics are here, launched in an historic opening ceremony held in a number of Italian locations simultaneously. Follow all the action in our live blog.

item.title: ABC 50/50 quiz: This week we're testing your knowledge of Gladiator, James Bond and your right to party
item.description: Every question has only two options: One is right and the other is wrong. You have an even chance of guessing correctly each time.

item.title: Former ambassador Ian Kemish writes about Europe's 'forgotten' war in debut novel Two Islands
item.description: Former ambassador Ian Kemish draws on his 25-year diplomatic career in his debut novel, Two Islands, set against the backdrop of the Balkan War.

item.title: Why your home loan repayments aren't included in official inflation figures
item.description: Mortgage repayments are going up, but they aren't included in the key official inflation figure, the consumer price index. Here's why.

item.title: British PM Sir Keir Starmer pressured to resign amid fallout of Peter Mandelson's ties to Jeffrey Epstein
item.description: Sir Keir Starmer led Labour to a landslide election victory two years ago, but in the past week, things have unravelled for the British prime minister. What went wrong?

item.title: Elders say truth-telling 'critical' to combatting racism after alleged terror attack
item.description: For Noongar elders, the alleged attack on Borloo/Perth is viewed against the background of a long history of violence. They are calling for a truth-telling commission to heal deep scars and help to combat racism.

item.description: As another T20 World Cup sneaks up on us, here's everything you need to know about the tournament, including a guide on how to pick which team to support, depending on your needs.

item.title: Inside the 'textbook' search for Gus Lamont
item.description: A retired police officer who helped pioneer search guidelines used during the investigation into the disappearance of Gus Lamont, praises the efforts to find the missing boy and expresses support for the detectives' conclusions.

item.title: Did Ouyen break Victoria's heat record? A Bureau of Meteorology issue means the town may never know
item.description: It was tipped to be one of the hottest places on Earth last week, but we may never know exactly how hot it got in Ouyen — at least officially.

item.description: The 14-year-old prodigy Vaibhav Sooryavanshi breaks Alyssa Healy's record with the highest score ever in a World Cup final to power India to the global under-19 crown.

item.description: A population of threatened golden bandicoots is booming at Newhaven Wildlife Sanctuary, north-west of Alice Springs.

item.title: Meringandan collector sells vintage tractors, trucks, machines on Queensland farm
item.description: As the last man standing, 78-year-old cattleman Mervyn has parted with his collection of tractors and utes, pledging his estate to charity.

item.description: The rich and powerful were all too happy to maintain connected to Jeffrey Epstein until it became the less convenient option.

item.title: Canberra man who murdered ex-wife in kitchen believed he had been badly treated, court hears
item.description: Disturbing new details emerge about the 2023 stabbing death of a woman in her Bruce home as her former partner faces sentencing for her murder in the ACT Supreme Court.
